title: How hard did the Covid-19 pandemic hit your business? - Quora

response.answer_text: As a small business owner in tier 3 city, the Corona pandemic has hit a jolt by hampering the cash flow as it is entirely dependent on day to day selling of goods and services. The total lockdown has hampered cash flow, and during 50+ days lockdown savings vanished. It also has vanquished the customer's willingness to buy goods for there nearing or future events, ceremonies, and celebrations in 2020. Uncertainty prevails for health threats in the covid19 situation and the number of people contaminated increasing rapidly has also created chaos in residents. Which is not going to end unless and until proper vaccination is not available of the corona. The overall influence of 70% to our YOY business figures is the impact during 2 months of unlocking months (adding the impact of 2 months of complete lockdown is devastating as well). Which is shocking and unable to compensate in the coming year 2020–21. Frankly, none of us are prepared for the pandemic and we shall overcome with permanent scars. It will be a blessing if we don't have to face a loss of life in the family. God bless India

As a result of the economic crisis created by the pandemic, almost 1 billion have suffered massive job losses and unemployment drastically increased. Covid 19 outbreak effected many life's.. when this covid 19 showed up, my friend he was working in one the reputed company almost from 3 years but in the month of March 27th lost his job and asked to leave, he was very much tensed as he took loan of 4 lakhs recently for personal issues..he was jobless more then 3 months, not only him there are many more just like him who lost their jobs still searching for job and end up getting less pay.
